710567f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue at S. E. corner of 44th Street.
June 1925.

713203f-a.text:
459, 461, 463, 465 West 44th Street, adjoining and at the N. E. corner of Tenth Avenue. No. 461 is the West Side Methodist Episcopal Church, recently reopened under that name; prior to
1920 it was Jane's Methodist Episcopal Church.
No. 465, the corner house, will be demolished before 1930. Later (about 1932) the church and No. 463 will be demolished and replaced by a new 5- story building.
May 20, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

713205f-a.text:

Avenue, showing Public School No. 51.

710569f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue at and adjoining the N. W. corner of 44th Street. The house in the centre, 605 Tenth Avenue, 1s a three-story
frame house with a brick front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection,Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 499.

710570f-c.text:
(1)
Tenth Ave., west side, from 44th to 45th Streets.
February 5, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Tenth Ave., west side, from 44th to 46th Streets.
February 5, 1932.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, showing a view farther north. The old tenements on the block from West 44th to West 45th Streets, seen in views 1 and 2, have been demolished and its site is now occupied by a l-story building to be used for stores.
December 4, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
